titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3682) to amend title 18, United States Code, to prohibit taking minors across State lines to avoid laws requiring the involvement of parents in abortion decisions.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 105-623, by Mrs. Myrick.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 3682 with 2 hours of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. The amendment recommended by the Committee on the Judiciary now printed in the bill shall be considered as adopted. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 226.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 252 - 174 (Roll No. 277).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 247 - 173 (Roll No. 278).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 7/14/1998--Introduced. Sets forth the rule (closed) for the consideration of H.R. 3682 (prohibition against taking minors across State lines to avoid laws requiring the involvement of parents in abortion decisions).
